newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Pacific Plywood hits record high.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Plywood hits record high.

text.p: Malaysian plywood maker Pacific Plywood Holdings Ltd hit a record high in late trade on talk that it was seeking a secondary listing in Singapore, brokers said.
"Speculation about an exceptional gain and brighter earnings in future if the secondary listing plan becomes reality fueled buying," said a senior manager at regional brokerage.
The shares rose HK$0.15 or 5.22 percent to a record HK$3.025 on volume of 16.26 million shares.
Brokers cited rumours of a Singapore secondary listing and an issue of American depositary receipts next year, but there were no details.
Company officials were not available for comment.
Brokers said they expected the shares to remain firm in the short run.
